title.rendered: 12 Best Things To Do In Dublin

content.rendered:
Hidden in one of the world’s smallest capital cities is a plethora of activities for you to do and sights for you to see. Whether you’re new in town, or a local just looking for new things to do, then you’re in the right place. The city of Dublin is filled with a lot of unique and fun activities that will be sure to lighten up your day. Here are the 12 best things to do in Dublin, Ireland.

Related: Finding Rooms for Rent in Dublin

Must try outdoor activities in Dublin

1. Take a trip to the Dublin Zoo

One of Dublin’s most popular attractions, the Dublin Zoo is one of the best places you can visit – especially if you’ve got kids with you! There are plenty of animals to see, with lots of kiosks, a restaurant, a shop, and the exciting Meerkat Café. An educational and fun experience where you can get up close and personal with some cuddly creatures.

  • Cost: Ranges from single to group tickets
  • Timings: 9:30a.m – 7:30 p.m
Website
Tickets
Directions

2. The Wicklow Mountain Tours

This tour is packed with fun adventures that make it an enjoyable experience from start to finish. You can visit previous movie locations, take great photos, and have a hearty meal in a traditional restaurant and pub in Dublin, Fitzgerald’s.

  • Cost: Starting from $29
  • Timings: 10 a.m. – 6 p.m
Tickets
Directions

3. Explore the Cliffs of Moher

Voted as the seventh most wonderful heritage site in the world by UNESCO, the Cliffs of Moher is definitely one of the best places to visit in Dublin. Included in this tour is coastal drives, views of the Atlantic Ocean, a trip to Doolin Village and popular restaurants in Dublin such as Gus O’Connor’s.

  • Cost: Average price is €7.0 for adults; free for children
  • Timings: Open 24 hours
Website
Ticket
Directions

4. Musical Pub Crawl for a full Irish experience

This evening pub crawl has it all: traditional Irish music, storytelling and drinks. You’ll be accompanied by two talented musicians who provide you with a ‘mobile concert’, singing Irish tunes while taking you around the local pubs.

Cost: €16.0 – €49

Website
Tickets
Directions

5. Sneak a peek at the Irish President’s home in Phoenix Park

This park, which is also home to the Dublin Zoo, is the largest enclosed urban park in Europe. Here, you’ll find playgrounds to excite your kids, historical sites, cafés, tea rooms and even the home of Ireland’s President, Arás an Uachtaráin. It is perfect for a sunny day, and open for 24 hours.

  • Cost: Admission is free at the gate; prices start from $27.00
  • Timings: Open 24 hours
Website
Tickets
Directions

Restaurants in Dublin

1. Sophie’s Rooftop Bar to light up your evenings

This beautiful rooftop restaurant is located in The Dean. They serve succulent, mouth-watering meals while providing customers with a full view of Dublin and Cork City. It is one of the best places to visit in Dublin for a memorable experience as you wind down for the evening.

  • Cost: From $7
  • Timings: Closes 10:30 p.m
Website
Bookings
Directions

2. Visit Delahunt

This high-end restaurant is a must-visit restaurant in Dublin. Apart from providing good customer service, they have unveiled a new covered terrace where customers can enjoy a relaxing setting during mealtimes.

  • Cost: Opens 5 p.m
  • Timings: From €20
Website
Bookings
Directions

3. Try Craft

Owned by Chef Philip Yeung, this award-winning restaurant in Dublin serves traditional Irish, European, and contemporary meals, in a casual setting. If you’re looking for a place to unwind after a long day or seeking new places to try the local dishes, this is a good choice.

  • Cost: Check Website
  • Timings: Opens 6p.m on Thursdays
Website
Bookings
Directions

4. Experience nature in The Garden Room

The Garden Room is a great place, both for a day out with friends or a meeting with business clients. This restaurant has a lot of positive reviews, because of its airy, open feel and eclectic selection of dishes.

  • Cost: $29-$83
  • Timings: 7 a.m
Website
Bookings
Directions

Museums in Dublin

1. Little Museum

The Little Museum is nothing like its name suggests. Known as ‘Dublin’s Best Museum Experience’, the Little Museum is one of the best places to visit in Dublin for a taste of the city’s history. You can explore and participate in the Little Treasure Hunt or the walking tours of Stephen’s Green.

  • Cost: From $12
  • Timings: Opens 10 a.m
Website
Tickets
Directions

2. Irish Whiskey Museum

Perfect for whiskey lovers, this building of historical relevance offers a vast selection of Irish Whiskey for its customers. Its live traditional music, storytelling, events, and diverse provision of whiskey make it a great opportunity to try something new.

  • Cost: $12
  • Timings: From 10 a.m
Website
Tickets
Directions

3. Visit the National Leprechaun Museum

Here, you will discover Irish magic and folklore, making it one of the best places to visit in Dublin. It is claimed to be the first leprechaun museum, and tourists will have a blast learning about the world of leprechauns conveyed through Irish storytelling.

  • Cost: €14
  • Timings: From 10 a.m
Website
Tickets
Directions

It’s very walkable with plenty of cafes, restaurants, and pubs to stop at along the way!…
